tripreview.Title: "A must visit at Munnar"
tripreview.sentence: Its a must visit place at Munnar where you can find mist around the year.
You need to buy tickets to the view point and walk down approx 100 mtrs to have the best view.
Steps are build to ease the walk.
Lots of small shops available with fruits and water.
Parking is available, but its best to park before reaching the destination, as parking inside is messy.

tripreview.Title: "The heaven"
tripreview.sentence: When i reached there it was very clear for the whole view but suddenly within seconds the fog came out and covered the whole place.
Now i wonder if i was standing in the cloudz.
Its was like freezing there.
Trecking is possible there.
And the most beautiful thing is that we can see a bunch of mountains from there
its a wonderful view and cannot take the eyes

tripreview.Title: "Great View"
tripreview.sentence: The top station in Munnar give a good view of great mountains.
We can see the tamil nadu from this view with lot of wind mills.
You must visit Top staion when go to Munnar.

tripreview.Title: "Have tea at top station!!!"
tripreview.sentence: When i visited with family
It was cold, rainy and full of fog in October
Nice Spot for a lil tea n do not miss the exotic tropical fruits they sell
passion fruits for 7 rupees
its a very high view point but worth all the travel !

tripreview.Title: "Visit only if you must"
tripreview.sentence: First of all, there are 262 steps that you need to climb down to get to this point.
Second, if there is mist, there is absolutely nothing you will see.
Third, even if you are able to see stuff, tea gardens are far more picturesque than this destination.

tripreview.Title: "Top of the world!"
tripreview.sentence: Amazing view.
We actually walked down all the way to the second station with two kids.
We saw many huffing and puffing on the way up.
It is really worth the trek.
But you really need to be lucky to get a clear view.
Most of the times it is closed.
There is no place to rest at second station if it rains.
Take an umbrella along.

tripreview.Title: "Misty foggy serenity"
tripreview.sentence: My favourite spot in Munnar.
The ride there was a bit scary.
The visibility in the fog was very low, and the roads are twisty turny without much protection/barriers on the sides.
But if we hadn't gone to Top Station, we wouldn't really have had the best experience in Munnar.
To be fair, Top Station is just outside of the actual Police jurisdiction of Munnar.
Some 2.5 km away into Tamil Nadu.
There is nothing but a roadside board that lets you know that you are now entering the other state.
Once a top station, there wasn't much of a view, given the fog and mist.
But the cold and crisp wind more than alerted us to the fact that we were at one of the highest points in Munnar.
We had hot tea from an unassuming tea stall.
A simple yet perfect icing on the cake.

tripreview.Title: "Wrong time of day"
tripreview.sentence: If you want to visit then check with your driver/guide the best time to go.
We only found out once it was too late that we should have gone early morning.
The drive up is lovely and worth it however you couldn't see anything from the top.

tripreview.Title: "Great View"
tripreview.sentence: We visited this place afternoon.
The view from Top station was amazing.
It was kinda distance from the Munnar city point.

tripreview.Title: "Sun Set...."
tripreview.sentence: We reached by our Car around 5pm.
Wow
Amazing
Don't miss to view Sun Set.
On the Way to Top Station was unforgettable.
While returning back to Munnar in Night was Very thrilling.
Near Mattupetty u may see Elephants.

tripreview.Title: "Heavenly place"
tripreview.sentence: It takes time to drive to this place from munnar.
But the time is really worth.
Fog covering mouontain ranges is a awesome view.
Walk inbetween tea gardens to get the feel of fog, have fresh tea in dabha on road side.
Overall exellent experience.

tripreview.Title: "Its not just another view point!"
tripreview.sentence: Due to time constraints it was a hard decision to make weather to visit KRajamalai (Eravikulam) National Park or the Top station.
Most of the tourists tourist package vehicles visit the echo point on the road leading to Top station and return to Munnar to visit Rajamalai (Eravikulam) National Park that is on the other route.
Due to this reason the Rajamalai (Eravikulam) National Park is crowded and have long queues to buy tickets during peak season.
Being aware of this problem we decided to visit Top station as it has one of the best ratings online.
The road after the echo point to the top station had less traffic as the other roads.
The journey to Top station offered various mesmerising views of the tea gardens and the hill range.
Mostly the taxi drivers are reluctant to visit Top station as it lies in Tamil Nadu and owing to the problems of insurance claims and legality in case of any mishap, they are not willing to go there.
But we negotiated with our taxi driver to take us there.
On reaching there one can't guess the heavenly views ahead.
The entrance and parking is not that well designed and an undeveloped walking pathway of about a kilometre leads to the actual viewpoint.
One has to buy very cheap tickets from the Tamil Nadu govt.
ticket stall.
to walk down to the view point.
The steps are not well developed that might cause some trouble to the aged and women.
But the scenes on cards are worth making that effort.
One feels to be floating on the moving clouds, The opening and closing visions offered by the visible clouds makes one surprise even after staying there for some time.
The views are not static as in other viewpoints.
The moving clouds offer dynamic views of the valley and the hill range.
Few food stalls are constructed just before the ticket counter.
Noodles, wafers, fruits etc can be enjoyed on the visit.
But I feel the viewpoints still has a huge scope for infrastructure development to make it more tourist friendly.

tripreview.Title: "Very nice view"
tripreview.sentence: very scenic and adorable views.
We had spent couple of hours there and enjoyed the weather and clouds there.

tripreview.Title: "Heaven in Earth"
tripreview.sentence: Its like a heaven , you can walk through fogs .
I visited in october and the time around 1 pm.
Even its noon the mist is very high and i love to drive and walk through this area.

tripreview.Title: "The height!!!!"
tripreview.sentence: Love this place in munnar.
Connecting Kerala and Tamilnadu this place is a really awesome and breath taking view.
You will be able to see the nature's magic from this place with fog all around you.
Best place you can ever see in munnar along with the tea gardens

tripreview.Title: "Mesmerizing top station!!"
tripreview.sentence: 40 kms away from munnar in madupattey direction, top station is a mesmerizing view.
Enjoy noodles, tea.
With an entry fee of 20/- u can see the beautiful top view of munnar and adjacent areas.

tripreview.Title: "Unforgettable Awesome experience"
tripreview.sentence: Good view to tea garden of tamilnadu and kerrla, its a border , you can see the difference in roads.
Excellent tracking- it was good cardiac exercise- cool breeze - cloudy, you feel like in touching cloud.

tripreview.Title: "Overhyped view point"
tripreview.sentence: This is like any other view points that one can see in major hill stations , can easily give it a miss.

tripreview.Title: "View of the Tea Hills from the Top"
tripreview.sentence: As the name suggests it is one of the highest locations on the border of Kerala.
from the top you can see the Tea plants down hill.

tripreview.Title: "don't bother if it might be clouded over"
tripreview.sentence: We went on a day that was partly cloudy (sunny in Munnar, but light rain in the evenings).
Top Station could be beautiful, but it isn't worth the trip unless you know it will be clear.

tripreview.Title: "Lush Green mountain range"
tripreview.sentence: You can see lush green mountain range from this point.
Many a times it could be covered with thick fog as it happened during our visit, but we had also having strong winds and we could see the beauty through the passing thick clouds.

tripreview.Title: "Waste of time"
tripreview.sentence: Believe me the place is such a bore,there's nothing much here.
The place is not even clean.
Came here with my family and was a waste of time.

tripreview.Title: "Noting great"
tripreview.sentence: Typical view point.
Not worth the 30+ minutes travel from echo point and the 200 odd steps.
Parking space is not properly organized - totally haphazard.

tripreview.Title: "Awesome place"
tripreview.sentence: The place was covered with clouds.
Tea estates could be seen everywhere.
We plucked some leaves also.
Weather was chilly.
Amazing view.

tripreview.Title: "Breathtaking view of Munnar!"
tripreview.sentence: This was one of the most beautiful views I have ever seen in my life!
I find all of India gorgeous, but the view from the Top Station took my breath away.
Scenic mountains in a heavenly mist!

tripreview.Title: "Don't go there, travel is not worth it"
tripreview.sentence: You can get the same view driving in rikshaw anywhere in Munnar.
Too many stalls all the view is blocked purposely and some private folks will let you go beyond the scaffolding to get the view after charging some money.

tripreview.Title: "Amazing View"
tripreview.sentence: The view from the top point is amazing.
You have to walk down the stairs and come up again.
Not preferred for Heart patient and pregnant lady.

tripreview.Title: "Top of the mountain"
tripreview.sentence: visited summer and winter time that place.

tripreview.Title: "Top of a misty mountain"
tripreview.sentence: Get ready for a short walk and climb down the steps.
(Remember you have to climb all the way later) From the view point we can see a quite a lot of places in the Kerala-Tamil Nadu border.
Sometimes fog may cover the places.
But most of the times it's a delightful experience.

tripreview.Title: "Good Place"
tripreview.sentence: Very good place to visit.
You can see few districts of TN from this place.
Roads are bad in certain places.

tripreview.Title: "Top Station"
tripreview.sentence: Awesome view and phenomenal photographic location.
This place is quiet serene and idyllic.
it looks like the clock never ticks in this part of the world.
Slow, steady and cheerful.
Good place.

tripreview.Title: "Waste of Time and Effort"
tripreview.sentence: Top Station is located 7kms beyond Kundalay Dam, a few Kms inside Tamil Nadu.
The 7kms drive has some all-round Scenic Views, though nothing spectacular.
Top Station itself has nothing special to offer.
The Rs.25 per person is Outrageous, considering the crude, shabby arrangements provided.
Clearly, this place is a Kill Joy.

tripreview.Title: "High Tea"
tripreview.sentence: High atop the division between two states of Kerala and Tamil Nadu is Top Station.
You can see both the states from here.
Lush green gardens of tea and wild forests abound.

tripreview.Title: "heaven on earth"
tripreview.sentence: As the name suggest its really top station , u can see Tamil nadu border .

tripreview.Title: "Go early morning or late afternoon"
tripreview.sentence: Go early morning or late afternoon for very nice views into Tamil Nadu.

tripreview.Title: "must visit"
tripreview.sentence: a must visit place, went there in sept 15 end.
it is little cold out there.
i was told that it is the highest point in southern india.
the tea plantations were very beautiful there.
although we couldnt get a full view as there was heavy mist.
late afternoons might be a better time to visit there.

tripreview.Title: "Wonderful place"
tripreview.sentence: Wow place.
If sky is clear you can see towns in Tamil nadu.

tripreview.Title: "Wow..."
tripreview.sentence: Ohh man, what a great place to see.
You will be mesmerized after seeing this place.
Awesome view
Must visit.

tripreview.Title: "Misty magic"
tripreview.sentence: One should not miss to see this point of pinnacle which is awesome and nervetickling, Grand views,adventurous walks and misty cover, worth the money spent.

tripreview.Title: "Highly Commercial"
tripreview.sentence: It was a good and peaceful place when we last visited it about 10 years back.
It was free too.
Now it is full of small small shops and even the nature's view is priced, we have to pay to see the view from Top station.
Its not worth travelling that much distance, we can see much better and similar views on our journey to and within Munnar.

tripreview.Title: "Its a Lovely View"
tripreview.sentence: Its on a 30-45 mins drive from munnar on the way you can see Echo point some lake and all.
Its a small road that goes to this point, have to take a ticket extra for camera also and then you have to trek down the hill.
Lovely Valley View with tall lush green mountains with some view of some city down the mountain and clouds coming and going great view.
There was some camping option also available.

tripreview.Title: "Must visit place in Munnar"
tripreview.sentence: This is the highest point in Munnar and its wonderful.
On the top of this point, you actually cross into Tamilnadu.
This place is covered with fog most of the time, which makes it too good.
Last 2-3 Kms to reach this place are not so good and also you have to walk down some 300 mts to reach the point, and climb back also :).
Overall, a must visit point in Munnar.

tripreview.Title: "Avoid it"
tripreview.sentence: This place is called a top station but there are many hills around which are taller than this place which can offer better viewing points.
Its a long and arduous journey of 2 hours from the town of Munnar but definitely not worth the effort.
The place is crowded and offers hardly any good restaurants to have breakfast/lunch.
An alternate suggestion is to stop 10 kms before reaching Top Station and explore the villages situated between the hills.
The villages are beautiful just like in a painting.
You will enjoy the experience of exploring the villages multi fold than going to Top Station.

tripreview.Title: "Give it a miss. OK is you are a photographer looking for valley shots"
tripreview.sentence: Maybe we visited at the wrong time but strangely the views from here were not so great.
Also, some political party workers have setup a barrier on the stairs leading to this point and they charge money for let people pass!
The only highlight was the yummy food and some crafts we bought from the locals here.

tripreview.Title: "Breathtaking views"
tripreview.sentence: The view from viewpoint is spectacular.
Climate was wonderful.
Food options are limited near the place.
Fog could play spoilsport.

tripreview.Title: "Great views, lovely approach"
tripreview.sentence: The road from Munnar to Top Station, past Pattupetty, is probably the best in the region around Munnar.
For one, it is a road with two lanes - which makes navigation much easier.
Another, there are multiple attractions along this road.
Top Station itself is a pretty good spot - much has been written about it, and it is certainly worth the visit.
We went when it was raining but the rains stopped when we reached - so we got some pretty ethereal views of the surroundings.

tripreview.Title: "Good View of Valley and Hills"
tripreview.sentence: We visited To Station on 20th Sep'2015 as part of sight seeing @ Munnar as part of our Kerala Tour.
Excellent view of Valley and mountains from the almost 300 Mtr down of top station.
Climate was some what cloudy which adds to beauty of green valley.
It also provides beautiful view of Tamilnadu.
Worth seeing place in and around Munnar.

tripreview.Title: "Drive was good but the place was average...."
tripreview.sentence: Nothing much to see here.
Just a end of road with good view and two small shops.
Our trip to this place was thrilled by thick mist covering the roads.

tripreview.Title: "Good view"
tripreview.sentence: Excellent view of Tailnadu.
Great climate and ambience.
Need to walk for sometime but its worth to spend the time.
Need to walk for sometime but its worth to spend the time.

tripreview.Title: "Feel the place"
tripreview.sentence: The feelis what you like when you are here
Away from the city chaos
Just a place to close your eyes and feel it.

tripreview.Title: "Cant describe in words. Must visit"
tripreview.sentence: This scenic beauty cannot be explained in words.
On the way to the top station, we saw bunch of wild elephants in the lawns.
This top station has got excellent view.
Must visit.

tripreview.Title: "Feel the clouds floating around you..."
tripreview.sentence: Munnar is a place with scenic beauty of mother nature.
A visit to munnar makes our mind and body get relaxed and helps us bring back everlasting memories.
Top station is one of the place with highest altitude in munnar.
You can feel the clouds around you as if you are in between the clouds
If lucky we may also get a chance to see elephants on the way to top station.
We can also experience the chilling fog on the way

tripreview.Title: "Nice place in Munnar"
tripreview.sentence: This is a one of the best view point in Munnar.
if you are visiting here plan in early morning time its looks very beautiful for sun rise and sun set as well.

tripreview.Title: "Need more stars!"
tripreview.sentence: This truly is God's work.
A mesmerising view of the mountains covered in billowy clouds, it's a sight to behold.
It is situated on the border of TN and Kerala and is rather easily accessible as the roads are excellent.
As per our guide, the clouds come down to the road around 1 pm, which is when the place is filled with tourists.
I reached the place around 11 am and was blessed with sunny view of the mountains in the distance.
I got a calm and peaceful time to take in the beauty.

tripreview.Title: "Mesmerising views"
tripreview.sentence: ever since i started my research for munnar, i knew that i would have to visit this place for-sure.
top station is located around 35-40 kms from munnar town center and it is definitely worth travelling over there.
soon after you start for top station, you start passing through various other famous sight seeing places which is an added advantage.

make sure you keep atleast half a day for sightseeing towards top station, this will include all major places like mattupetty dam, kundala dam, echo point, shooting point, indo-swiss farm etc and finally comes top station.
the road to top station is sheer fun to ride a bike or incase for a drive aswell.
you have to do a bit of walking towards the view point, but iam sure it will be worthy enough considering the breath taking views.

tripreview.Title: "Best in Seneric beauty"
tripreview.sentence: We went there during Sept.
Its around 1 KM track with lots of stairs.

tripreview.Title: "ENJOY the view, cool refreshing air and THE CHOCOLATES ??"
tripreview.sentence: Top station is one of the best places in Munnar.
Great view and cooool refreshing air on top.
Don't ever miss this if you are visiting Munnar.
Another point to mention- I am a big fan of homemade chocolates and i found that you can get chocolates here at a lower price.
I was keep checking the price during the trip.
A 100 g chocolate box costs you Rs.
50 in Shops near Mattupetti Dam and Rs.
40 in shops near Kundala Dam and much more in Munnar town.
But I bought 100g for only Rs.
30 from a shop here.
And the quality was good.

tripreview.Title: "Nice place to visit"
tripreview.sentence: Best place to visit in Munnar with beautiful view.
It is always good to spent an hour when you are at this place.

tripreview.Title: "Good view of valley"
tripreview.sentence: You get good view of the valley.

tripreview.Title: "Best place of Munnar"
tripreview.sentence: One of best places in Munnar, I would say.
The view from here is too good.
We tend to forget ourselves looking at Gigantic hills around.
The approach road to this very place is little tough but its completely worth it.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful place"
tripreview.sentence: If you can walk the walk, then Top Station is truly tops !
We went in heavy mist and fog, and it was freezing at the top.
It's a lovely experience, but we did also find it somewhat crowded.
This place is quite popular with the crowds.
On the plus side, you will have no difficulty finding it!
Its best to go with friends and enjoy the serene beauty of this place!

tripreview.Title: "Amazingly Munnar....."
tripreview.sentence: Just WooooW
Wonderful Munnar
Was dere with my family
Lots of Tea Farm, Weather is Excellent and River adds the attraction, very quiet and pleasant place
very clean and neat Hill Station
Just Amazingly Good to be dere
Must visit

tripreview.Title: "fresh air"
tripreview.sentence: make sure you have an experienced driver with you.
we were lucky to have one.
always listen to the guide.

tripreview.Title: "One Got to be Real Lucky One !!"
tripreview.sentence: Reaching the top and not able to experience the view is disappointing.
Most of the time because of its altitude, top station will be covered with fog.
But if you are lucky you can see entire munnar from top.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful place "
tripreview.sentence: Beautiful place
Beautiful view n best location Only problem 40km far from munnar city
u should walk nearly 1 km to reach this top station view
fat and old people finds tuff to visit

tripreview.Title: "Great views from Top Station"
tripreview.sentence: Great views !
On a clear day, you can see madurai !
Plan to go down (yes, its ironic) all the way to the edge.

tripreview.Title: "Great view "
tripreview.sentence: Perfect view of beauty of the nature along with cloudy mountains and good view .
A little car parking facility .

tripreview.Title: "Munnar Top Station"
tripreview.sentence: The highest point (1700m) on the Munnar-Kodaikanal road.
The panoramic view of the majestic Western Ghats from top station is great.
Top Station name was derived from the fact that it was the uppermost railway station located in the Kundala Valley.
The Tea packets were used to be transported in the olden days to Kottagudi through the ropeway system here.
Even now also some part of the rope way station remains there.
The area is very popular for the Neelkurinji flowers (Strobilanthus), which bloom once in 12 years.
The Kurinjimala Sanctuary is also located very near.
Top Station is easily accessible from Munnar as frequent buses are run by the public transport.
You can also get Cabs to go to Top station from Munnar as a day trip/excursion.

tripreview.Title: "Awesome Experience"
tripreview.sentence: I think this place is very well named as it is on top and then it attracts you with all the positive wind around it.

tripreview.Title: "hill like heaven"
tripreview.sentence: top station one of the most beautyfull one
going here by trekking is very interesting one.

tripreview.Title: "Nice view if you make it all the way down the steep slope."
tripreview.sentence: The descent and the climb back can be tough given the steep incline.
Keep a water bottle handy.
Choose a mildly cloudy day for the visit.
On a hot day, the climb can be tiring.

tripreview.Title: "Fantastic Place must to See and Feel."
tripreview.sentence: Very Nice place to hangout.
Lots of greenery , tea farm and spectacular view of Greens hills can surely Kill all worries and give peace.
Fantastic Place must to See and Feel.

tripreview.Title: "Long drive for not much!!!!"
tripreview.sentence: The place is too commercial buzzing with shops.
And the view is great but I guess its not worth the pain that you take to get to this place.

tripreview.Title: "Good location for those who are ready to walk alot.."
tripreview.sentence: Nice view but this place is for those who are habitual of climbing stairs and have alot of stamina
To reach the main point you have to go down from the mountain
We could only walked half way as we had kids with us but view from there was great
So if you are physically fit n strong then you must go n see this place

tripreview.Title: "Great place "
tripreview.sentence: Perfect view of beauty of the nature along with cloudy mountains

tripreview.Title: "Great view.."
tripreview.sentence: Pretty good view.
but need to break a lot of stairs to reach the place
returning back is more difficult as u need to climb the stairs back

tripreview.Title: "Top station view will mesmerize"
tripreview.sentence: Silver clouds passing over the ghats.
Fantastic view.
But we got a better view 2kms away from Top Station, near Tamilnadu border.

tripreview.Title: "topstation munnar"
tripreview.sentence: Top Station is 44 km from munnar town, and is appropriately named.
This is the main abode to the highest tea plantations of India.
It takes one hour to reach Top Station from Munnar.
It is located on the borders of both the states, Kerala as well as Tamilnadu and dictates an absolute panoramic view.
Tourists keep visiting top station as it is in the Theni district of Tamil Nadu and Idukki district of Kerala.
It is at an altitude of 1700 meters.
This area is famous for exceptional flowers such as Neelakurinji flowers.
Neelakurunji, which blooms once in 12 years.
This flower adds double fragrance to Full Munnar Tea plantation making Hill blue in Colour.
Last time, it has bloomed in the year 2006.
Buses ply frequently between Munnar and Top Station.
Its not advisable to visit Top station be-tween June to October as the roads become slippery.

tripreview.Title: "A great view"
tripreview.sentence: Took some time to reach the top station and its an interesting walk down to the view point!
Enjoyed the strong winds and great weather.
Excellent choice to relax and enjoy the view of the valleys.
But the pathway leading to the view point is challenging, especially for elderly people.

tripreview.Title: "Not worth on a Sunny day"
tripreview.sentence: The journey was more pleasure even though the road in the last 5 km was bad,Seeing sights like Mattupatty dam and Echo Point.
The actual Top Station located in TamilNadu is a litttle disappointing First its looks mostly like a small fair with stalls selling tea coffee and omelettes.
The actul view point point is located down a flight of stairs and its a private property charging different rates for indians and Foreigners.
u do get some good photos if there is a fog or if its cloudy, but unfortunately when i visited it was very hot and sunny so was completely unsatisfied with it.

tripreview.Title: "Deep forests, Mists and clouds.."
tripreview.sentence: We were pleased to reach this place.
From top Station we could see the panoramic view of Western Ghats and the valley of Theni district of Tamil Nadu.
The clouds can be touched form here.
We felt the clouds hitting our face.
This is the place where Neelakurinji flowers blossoms once in 12 years.

tripreview.Title: "Photo Perfect"
tripreview.sentence: Since we stayed in the Sterling and had our own vehicle with a local driver he took us there early morning.
The view of the tea gardens from there was simply awesome and outstanding with lined green trees everywhere.
Worth a visit if you can wake up early and have a cab at your disposal else the local cabs charge a hefty amount.

tripreview.Title: "Good place"
tripreview.sentence: Top station is a very nice place to visit at munnar.
Our driver refused to go ther first pointing the distance.
But we demanded to go and it was real worth.

tripreview.Title: "good view"
tripreview.sentence: The area is a private spot.
You have to take a ticket to go for the view point.
From the ticketing counters, there is a way down to the spot through a lot of stairs.

tripreview.Title: "Take off point for Park Tour."
tripreview.sentence: People kept mentioning topstation and I thought it was just a local name for the mountain location, Turns out that's the actual name of one of the highest points.
From here we took a tour bus into the park located further up the mountain.
Foreigners pay 360 rupees.
Lots of people were here as well as it was during the Onam season.

tripreview.Title: "Awesome place"
tripreview.sentence: It is one of the best places in Munnar where one enjoys the nature at its best.
The place is surrounded by hills.
The misty clouds settling on the hills is the best view.
A must visit point.

tripreview.Title: "V.GOOD"
tripreview.sentence: You can experience fog covered atmosphere.
very good views for photo shooting, hill climbing opportunity, amazing view of the waterfall, mountain goats etc.
